description: A 2nd CE to mid 1st CE settlement. Excavations revealed a roundhouse in a horseshoe enclosure, in front of the building were around 100 pits with various deposits. A second excavation nearby produced similar pits with more articulated animal remains, tentatively suggested to be a shrine.
bibliography: Craster, M. D. “The Aldwick Iron Age Settlement, Barley, Hertfordshire.” The Proceedings of Cambridge Antiquarian Society 54 (1961): 22–46.
The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource. “Aldwick, Barley (Hertfordshire),” n.d. https://archaeologydataservice.ac.uk/archives/view/romangl/maprecord.cfm?id=3082.
